newsitem.title: USA: Consolidated Products cost controls aid Q2.
newsitem.headline: Consolidated Products cost controls aid Q2.

text.p: Consolidated Products Inc said Wednesday strict cost controls in its fiscal second quarter led to improved operating margins and stronger earnings.
"Tight management control over operating expenses, both food and labor costs, resulted in improved operating margins which also contributed to the record earnings," the company said in a statement.
On Wednesday, Consolidated reported earnings for its fiscal second quarter ended April 9 of $0.24 a share versus $0.18.
The company said it opened eight Steak n Shake restaurants during the quarter, which are expected to post first-year sales significantly above the new-unit average of $1.5 million.
Consolidated said it compeleted its expansion in the St. Louis and Indianapolis areas. Near-term plans include further development of markets in Florida, Michigan, Illinois, Ohio and Tennessee.
Consolidated currently operates 234 Steak n Shake restaurants.
